data.title: MA Multimedia Journalism
data.text:
Your application

We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and nationalities. Our diverse community includes students from countries such as Germany, Canada, Japan, Nigeria, India, Indonesia, Thailand, UAE, Morocco, Lebanon, and the UK. We also value diversity in academic backgrounds, with students joining us from business studies, anthropology, English, media and communication, and more.

Our course is designed to be inclusive and flexible, suitable for both new entrants to journalism and those looking to extend their skills across different media — in the UK and abroad. We're committed to creating a vibrant learning environment that reflects the global nature of journalism today.

In your application, we want to hear your story and understand what drives your passion for journalism. Please use your personal statement to tell us why you're drawn to MA Multimedia Journalism, and how you think it will help you achieve your career goals. Share your thoughts on the role of journalism in the changing world, and how you see yourself contributing to it.

We're also looking for evidence of your ability to adapt to challenging situations, work under pressure, and think creatively. If you have relevant experience in journalism or related fields, or special interests that drive your desire to undertake MA Multimedia Journalism, we'd love to hear about them. Please also refer to ‘What we are looking for’ while filling out your application.

Costs and fees

You can find full information about the deposits required and how to pay your fees in our postgraduate fees and funding section, including details of the Postgraduate Loan (subject to fee status).

All fees are quoted in pounds sterling and are per annum. Fees quoted are for tuition only unless stated otherwise. Your tuition fees will be the same for each year of your course.

Find out more about living expenses for postgraduate students
